resources.string: This view shows the local music collection of the user (a database would need to be created based on the local music collection). It would be useful to add an icon in the app bar which would toggle between the album view and the artist view. To read a list of artists/albums to display in this view, it would be necessary to look up all the audio files on a device and display them in the structure below. When any card is tapped, the user lands in the Songs view showing all songs in that album or by that artist.

This view shows all songs in an album or by an artist which the user selected on the main app screen. It would be necessary to populate the values for the artist\'s name, album name and tracks in the album dynamically depending on which album was selected in the main app view. In addition to \"Play all\" button below, it would be useful to also show individual Play buttons for each track (landing the user on \"Now playing\" page). A MediaPlayer class would need to be implemented for controlling playback. The app bar should contain the Up arrow to return to the previous view.

This view shows a song/album which is playing. It would be necessary to integrate a library with an audio player (such as OpenPlayer https://android-arsenal.com/details/1/1616 or JcPlayer https://android-arsenal.com/details/1/4638) for playing the music along with playback controls such as Play/Pause/Stop/Next track/Previous track as well as the time counter for when a song is playing. The app bar should contain the Up arrow to return to the previous view.

This view would show artists or albums which are similar to the one the user has locally. One would have to use a music library or a service which could perform such a lookup and display recommendations for streaming. Or possibly an API could be developed with a service such as Jango Radio which provides music recommendations and playlists based on a selected album/artist. The app bar should contain the Up arrow to return to the previous view.
